reviews.review_msg: Not a bad class to take online, I just didn't find it that interesting. Fairly straight forward, a few discussions, two papers and a final. Need to read the text. I found the marking was tougher, but the feedback was thoughtful.

Took the class online, Prof was completely absent and had absolutely no contact with students. Class is facilitated by two TA markers. My TA was bad at responding to questions, sometimes not really answering the questions and sometimes providing responses that were nonsensical... but marked really easy. I heard the other TA marked harder.

Took the class online in DE.  TA was not clear as to her expectations and claimed plagiarism even when that did not happen. The TA appeared to be running the show and Lucy was nowhere to be found. She did not address the class a single time. I essentially paid for a course to be taught by a sub-par graduate student. Not acceptable. Discussions imp.

I took EDUC 322 online and found the experience mediocre, if not forgettable. The TA is a fastidious marker (ie. giving .6/1) and does not really provide clear-cut instructions which is a bit of an annoyance. If given the choice, I would not take this class nor recommend it.  It is similar to PSYC children's development, take that instead.

Lucy is one of the best profs I've had. She really applies the concepts she is teaching to her own teaching style. Very clear and to the point. I love how this class was so straightforward. Even though there are weekly readings and written summaries I never felt stressed out. Most of class is discussions and if you pay attention you should do well.

If you show up to class and take notes, you'll definitely get a good mark. The vocabulary she uses is very simple to understand, it's like she cuts everything up into bite-sized pieces for you. I really recommend taking this class in person instead of online if you can.
Easy distance ed course. Four short discussions and two papers all marked very easy. The final was all multiple choice and only worth 35% so an A is attainable regardless of how you do on the exam.

Very disorganized. Never even followed her own course schedule.  Essentially a single-subject (attachment) instructor.  Very inconsistent grading practice and demonstrated biases against certain "types" of students. Missed appointments without reason.

Interesting class. I took it DE and Lucy never once spoke to the class. Even to say hello. The entire class was facilitated by the TM's who were nice enough. One didn't know the correct usage of a semicolon... problematic and no one to talk to about it. Exam was hard and chapters were on it that weren't on the outline. Unsettling! took them off tho
Class focuses on online discussions. Papers are straight forward and easy. Only the MC final exam brought my mark down. I'd only ask for the canvas site to be easier to navigate. Overall, good class.

Hugely reliant on class discussion. You only get one mark back the whole semester (the midterm) and the rest is a mystery. Very nice prof, though and very knowledgeable on the subjects that are covered. When she is lecturing, lectures are very interesting.
easy course, doesn't give back your paper, friendly
Taking this DE. Pretty straight-forward & an easy class to get through; the requirements are split up evenly so as long as you do your work steadily throughout the semester you'll do fine :)
